DOC.HEAD: Carrier Reports Quarterly Loss of $134.9 Million
DOC.TEXT: Braniff Inc., which filed for bankruptcy protection this fall, announced Thursday a net loss for the quarter ended Oct. 31 of $134.9 million, compared with a $7.8 million loss in the year-earlier period. The net loss per share for the quarter was $9.15, compared with a loss of 59 cents per share in the quarter ended Oct. 31, 1988. Operating revenues for the airline for the quarter totaled $98.9 million, down from $127.5 million for the same quarter in 1988. Braniff's consolidated operating loss for the quarter was $40.4 million, compared with a loss of $10.9 million in the quarter a year ago. Orlando-based Braniff filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection from creditors on Sept. 28 and substantially reduced its scheduled passenger service. On Nov. 6, Braniff suspended all scheduled flights. It remains a charter carrier.
